name: AzureCLI
description: Run a Shell or Batch script with Azure CLI commands against an azure subscription
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameSelector
inputs.label: Azure Connection Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure connection type for the Deployment

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: AzureRM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Classic Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Classic subscription for the deployment

inputs.name: scriptLocation
inputs.label: Script Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of script: File Path or Inline Script

inputs.name: scriptPath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fully qualified path of the script or a path relative to the the default working directory

inputs.name: inlineScript
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.helpMarkDown:
You can write your scripts inline here. For batch files use the prefix "call" before every azure command. You can also pass predefined and custom variables to this script using arguments 

 example for shell: azure --version || azure account show 

 example for batch: call  azure --version || call azure account show

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run.  Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail when any errors are written to the StandardError stream

messages.UnsupportedEndpointScheme: Unsupported Endpoint Authorization Scheme: Certificate and Username Password for Azure Classic and Service Principal for AzureRM
